On 10/13/06, j_cumps <j_cumps@...> wrote:
>
>
> > However, I want to =
write certain class which is at setUp() method
> to
> > make different test=
class sharing the same instaince and passing
> some
> > parameters. Is this=
 possible?
> >
>
> JUnit promotes test isolation.
> Test should not depend =
on other tests, or on the order they are run.
>
> Passing parameters from o=
ne test(case) to another is against JUnit
> nature.


Yes, users asking thi=
s question are often pointed to the "Parameterized Test
Case" design patter=
n, which simulates parameters by putting them in instance
fields and then h=
aving test methods use these instance fields.

Bottom line is:  parameters =
are good and useful, and both JUnit 4 and TestNG
support them (but not JUni=
t 3).

-- 
C=E9dric
http://testng.org
